CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - State to pay outstanding judgment debt;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the city of PERSON , GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against ORG “ GPE ” to recover unpaid salary . On DATE the court awarded him CARDINAL NORP hryvnas ( ORG ) in salary arrears .

CARDINAL . At DATE , the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG of GPE against the President of GPE , ORG , ORG and ORG , for compensation of pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage caused by the non - enforcement of the judgment in his favour . On DATE the court found against the applicant , stating that the applicant could have lodged appropriate claims for damages against ORG and not against the above defendants , whose responsibility for the non - enforcement of the judgment had not been proved by the claimant . The applicant did not appeal against this decision under the ordinary appellate and cassation procedures .
CARDINAL . By an order of DATE , the debtor company was liquidated and all the writs of execution were forwarded to the liquidation commission which had been established .

CARDINAL . By a letter dated DATE from ORG to other creditors , the applicant became aware that the judgment of CARDINAL DATE would not be enforced due to the large number of enforcement proceedings against the debtor . In addition , ORG had stated that the enforcement of the judgment by an attachment of property required the special authorisation of ORG due to the location of the debtor ’s property in the GPE area , contaminated by radioactivity .
CARDINAL . The judgment apparently remains unexecuted .
CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law can be found in GPE and Others v. GPE ( nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and following , § § CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL-XII ) .
